content: A federal judge in San Francisco has rejected credit bureau TransUnion's challenge to a $60 million jury award in a lawsuit accusing it of falsely reporting that consumers were on a terrorist watchlist  saying the award was supported by solid evidence.
name: TransUnion
title: Federal judge upholds $60 mln jury award against TransUnion

content: A California woman who was an authorized user on her parents' credit card account cannot sue TransUnion for including her parents' delinquencies on her credit report  a federal appeals court ruled.
name: TransUnion
title: 11th Circuit declines to revive lawsuit against TransUnion

content: TransUnion has asked a federal judge to order a new trial or to set aside a $60 million jury verdict awarded in June to consumers who said the credit bureau falsely reported that they were on a government watchlist of terrorists and other security threats.
name: TransUnion
title: TransUnion seeks new trial after 'staggering' $60 mln jury verdict

content: A jury in San Francisco federal court has awarded $60 million in damages to consumers who accused credit bureau TransUnion of falsely reporting that they were on a government list of terrorists and other security threats.
name: TransUnion
title: TransUnion hit with $60 million jury verdict over blacklist alerts

content: A U.S. regulator on Tuesday ordered credit reporting agencies TransUnion  and Equifax Inc  to pay more than $23.2 million in fines and restitution for deceiving consumers about the usefulness and cost of credit scores they bought.
name: TransUnion
title: U.S. fines TransUnion  Equifax for deceit over credit scores

content: OTTAWA  Nov 10 Canadians took on more consumer debt in the third quarter  and the delinquency rate rose  a major credit report provider said on Thursday in a report that was likely to increase policymaker's concerns about household borrowing levels.
name: TransUnion
title: Canadian consumers pile on more debt in third quarter -TransUnion

content: A federal magistrate judge in San Francisco has allowed to proceed a nationwide class action accusing credit reporting agency TransUnion of mistakenly identifying thousands of U.S. consumers as having criminal records or being on terrorist watch lists.
name: TransUnion
title: TransUnion must face lawsuit over reporting mistakes - ruling

content: Consumers alleging in a class action that credit bureau TransUnion sold them inaccurate  worthless credit scores online cannot be compelled to arbitrate their claims  a federal appeals court has ruled.
name: TransUnion
title: Consumer lawsuit against TransUnion can go forward- 7th Circuit
